title: Suspected jihadists kill 10 Niger soldiers
description: On Friday, the troops were on patrol in southwestern Niger, close to the Mali border, when they came under an ambush by a group of armed men, the Defense Ministry said Saturday.

title: Belgian lawmaker charged in EU graft probe
description: Prosecutors on Saturday charged Belgian MEP Marc Tarabella with corruption after searching his bank safe as part of a probe into a bribery scandal linked to Qatar that has rocked the EU.

title: Tens of thousands rally in Israel for sixth week against justice reform
description: The proposed judicial reform would allow Israel's parliament to overrule any Supreme Court decision with a simple majority of 61 lawmakers in the 120-seat body, as well as boost political control over the system through which judges are appointed.

title: The disappearance of the social issue highlights divisions in the United States
description: Despite President Joe Biden's frequent calls to the working class against Wall Street, US public life continues to be dominated by identity and societal issues.

title: The loneliness of the devastated Turkish village Büyüknacar
description: It took three days after the earthquake for the first rescuers to reach this village located in southern Turkey, where only 17 houses out of 190 are still standing.

title: New attack in East Jerusalem raises fresh escalation fears
description: A man drove his car into a bus stop on Friday, killing three, in the second such incident in two weeks.

title: French pension reform: More than 90,000 march in Paris on fourth day of protests
description: 93,000 demonstrated in the French capital according to the police, the unions counted 500,000 people.

title: Six Nations 2023: Ireland beat title holders France 32-19
description: Ireland ended France's 14-match winning run in a breathless game between the world's top two teams that lived up to its billing on Saturday.

title: Chinese balloon part of global spying program, US says
description: While a second flying object was destroyed by the US military on Friday, Washington says at least 'twenty' such Chinese missions have been taking place around the globe.

title: Armenia-Turkey border opened for first time in 35 years to allow aid through
description: The assistance comes after a 7.8-magnitude earthquake rocked Turkey and Syria, killing nearly 25,000 people in both countries.

title: Iran marks anniversary of Islamic Revolution amid protests
description: The celebration was a show of power to protesters who took to the street in September after a young woman died in police custody.

title: WHO chief visits Syria's quake-hit Aleppo
description: Tedros Adhanom Ghebreyesus says he is accompanying 'around 37 metric tonnes' of medical supplies to the war and quake-torn Syrian city.

title: Columbus, Ohio begins ambitious food waste fight
description: By the end of the decade, Ohio's capital city wants to halve the 170,000 tons of food dumped in a landfill each year.

title: French Pension reform: Demonstrators keen to keep pressure on Macron on fourth day of action
description: Unions hope to put up with a new show of force on Saturday, the fourth day of nationwide action against the reform and a key test for the future of the protest.

title: Following California's massive floods, many speculate over role of climate change
description: Californians seemed to have forgotten that floods are a feature of California's climate while scientists wonder to what extent global warming is involved.

title: Six Nations: French XV looking to scale 'this year's peak' in Ireland
description: On Saturday, one week on from their hard-fought victory in Rome, France faces their biggest challenge against the world's number one team, Ireland, in Dublin.

title: European insect populations tumble
description: Recent studies point out declines in insect numbers of 70-80% over the past several decades in areas hogged by human activities and intensive agriculture.

title: The life of not-so-welcomed Russian exiles in Georgia
description: The massive influx of Russians fleeing military mobilization in their home country presents unprecedented challenges as Georgia is still going through the trauma of the 2008 Russian invasion.

title: Burkina Faso and the roots of resentment against France
description: For the ruling junta in Ouagadougou, inciting anger against Paris has become a way of uniting the people.

title: A two-wheeled electric transition is taking place in Africa
description: Sales of battery-powered motorcycles and scooters are skyrocketing in countries such as Nigeria and Kenya. According to McKinsey, they’re expected to dominate sales on the continent by 2040, with a market share of 50% to 70%.

title: In Tunisia, sub-Saharan Africans subjected to growing racism
description: Despite the country's tradition of welcoming foreigners, an influx of migrants has been accompanied by a rise in discrimination, mistreatment and verbal attacks.

title: Transport Minister Clément Beaune: 'A strike is not a hostage-taking'
description: Ahead of another day of protests against pension reform on Saturday, February 11, the minister is hoping to balance the right to strike with respect for passengers.

title: New hope in the fight against tuberculosis
description: New vaccine trials, effective treatments, and breakthrough diagnostic methods show promise in the fight against the world's second deadliest infectious disease after Covid-19.

title: Six Nations 2023: The French team relies on data to understand humans
description: Since the arrival of Fabien Galthié as coach, the French national team, which travels to Ireland on Saturday for the big clash of this year's competition, has been using more and more data to improve its performance.

title: Discovery of a new species of pseudo-primates from 52 million years ago
description: Fossils discovered in the 1970s in Canada, reveal two species of the genus 'Ignacius' that evolved to adapt to a warm climate that plunged into darkness six months a year.

title: After Zelensky's visit to Paris, tensions escalate between Italy and France
description: Italian Prime Minister Giorgia Meloni took offense at not being invited to the meeting at the Elysée Palace with Chancellor Olaf Scholz and Emmanuel Macron, despite Rome's constant support for Kyiv.

title: French-Iranian academic Fariba Adelkhah released from Iranian prison
description: Up until Adelkhah's release, seven French citizens were being held by Iran, according to the French foreign ministry.

title: Biden and Lula discuss democracy, climate change and the War in Ukraine during visit
description: During the Brazilian president's visit to the White House, both Biden and Lula sought to spotlight that Brazil’s democracy remains resilient and that relations between the Americas’ two biggest democracies are back on track.

title: War in Ukraine: Russia launches new wave of aerial attacks
description: Meanwhile, US President Joe Biden announced he will visit Poland to mark the one year anniversary of Russia's invasion of Ukraine.

title: "Reducing social inequality in Brazil would appear to be essential for strengthening democracy and weakening extremism"
description: An uncertain economic climate could complicate Lula's ambitious social reforms needed to consolidate democracy. The European Union must show its commitment to Brazil.
